text.author: Wikinews
text.title: Parents prosecuted after homeopathic treatment leads to daughter's death
text.summary1: (human1) Indian Australian couple Thomas and Manju Sam are being prosecuted in Australia for manslaughter by gross negligence in the death of their nine-month old daughter Gloria, whose severe eczema they refused to treat using conventional medicing, instead opting for homeopathic treatments common in India, which are known to be ineffective.
text.summary2: (human2) A news report from Sydney, Australia dated Friday, May 8, 2009, details the case of husband and wife Thomas Sam and Manju Sam, who are being tried for manslaughter of their nine-month old, Gloria, after they refused to treat her severe eczema with conventional medicine, instead treating her themselves with homeopathy, an ineffective type of alternative medicine.
text.summary3: (human3) Thomas and Manju Sam of Sydney, Australia are undergoing trial for manslaughter after refusing to treat their nine-month-old child, Gloria, with conventional medicine, opting for pseudoscientific homeopathic remedies for her severe eczema instead, resulting in the child's death.
text.summary4: (human4) Parents, Thomas Sam and Manju Sam, are on trial for manslaughter by gross negligence after the untimely death of their nine month old daughter, Gloria, due to an alternative medicine treatment.
text.summary5: (human5) In May 2009, Thomas and Manju Sam from Sydney, Australia, are reported undergoing prosecution for manslaughter by gross negligence for their nine-month old daughter, Gloria, who died from an infection caused by severe eczema after they shunned effective conventional medical treatment in favor of homeopathy.
